Posts.Content: goldendragonlady wrote: I had an MRI done on Friday.  Just wondering how soon I can get the results.  I hate having to wait for test results. I have read that it has taken some people a week to get MRI results.  That seem like a loooong time for a test like this. Mary Did I mention I hate waiting.  Mary 2x bc survivor Dx 9/18/2008, IDC, <1cm, Stage I, Grade 2, 0/2 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: How soon should I get MRI results? goldendragonlady lovinmomma

Posts.Content: goldendragonlady wrote: I have been diagnosed again with IDC in my "good" breast.  I had lumpectomy, AC, and rads, and have been on tamo for 2 1/2 years.  This tumor has almost the same "personality" as the first time, but is half the size. How do they know it's a new cancer.  I know, I know, everything I have read says that bc only rarely spreads to the other breast, but how can they tell for sure?  Do they do some sort of test?  In any case what type of treatment do they reccomend when you have been taking tamox and it comes back anyway?? tumor #1 1.8 cm IDC histo 3 - 3, nuc 2 - 3, mitotic - 1 - 3, bloom-richardson 6/9.  Final path. tumor #2   .7 cm IDC histo 3 - 3, nuc 2 - 3, mitotic - 2 - 3, bloom-richardson 7/9   Core biopsy. Mary Mary 2x bc survivor Dx 9/18/2008, IDC, <1cm, Stage I, Grade 2, 0/2 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: new tumor or recurrence? goldendragonlady Member_of_the_Club

Posts.Content: goldendragonlady wrote: On 10/22/08 I had my second lumpectomy. I had one done in 05 on my right breast.  The first tumor was about the 1:00 position on the top of my breast about halfway between the top of my breast and my nipple. It was deep down, almost to the chest wall.  The 05 surgery was not very painful afterwards,  just a little soreness which gradually went away.  This new tumor was in my left breast about 1 inch below my nipple and about an inch deep.  It was a little sore at first but got better over the first week. The last couple of days though my nipple has become much more sensitive and hurts sometimes even when I am not moving around.  The pain is not bad, just distracting.  The surgeon made the incision along the line of my areola to reduce the visibility of the scar.  I went in to see my onc and she mentioned it looked a little swollen, but it was not painful then.  I go in to see the surgeon on Friday for my post surg check.  I have been trying to streatch it a little bit .  Maybe I over did it??  Are incisions more towards the nipple/lower part of the breast more painful??  Anybody know?? Mary Mary 2x bc survivor Dx 9/18/2008, IDC, <1cm, Stage I, Grade 2, 0/2 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Sore breast due to location of surgery?? goldendragonlady AllieM22
